content: Sentience refers to the capacity of an entity to experience subjective sensations, perceptions, and feelings. It is often used to describe the ability of animals, including humans, to have conscious experiences and to be aware of their surroundings, emotions, and thoughts. Sentient beings are capable of feeling pleasure, pain, joy, sorrow, and other emotions, and they are able to make choices and act based on their own volition. Sentience is sometimes used interchangeably with the term "consciousness," but the two concepts can have slightly different meanings depending on the context.
